remarks: First-order logic and set theory.  (Contributed by Jonathan Ben-Naim, 3-Jun-2011.)  (New usage is discouraged.)
statement:
bnj1379.1 $e |- ( ph <-> A. f e. A Fun f ) $.
bnj1379.2 $e |- D = ( dom f i^i dom g ) $.
bnj1379.3 $e |- ( ps <-> ( ph /\ A. f e. A A. g e. A ( f |` D ) = ( g |` D ) ) ) $.
bnj1379.5 $e |- ( ch <-> ( ps /\ <. x , y >. e. U. A /\ <. x , z >. e. U. A ) ) $.
bnj1379.6 $e |- ( th <-> ( ch /\ f e. A /\ <. x , y >. e. f ) ) $.
bnj1379.7 $e |- ( ta <-> ( th /\ g e. A /\ <. x , z >. e. g ) ) $.
bnj1379 $p |- ( ps -> Fun U. A ) $.
$d A f g x y z $.
$d D x $.
$d g ph $.
$d ps x y z $.
